summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant conducted by SDNY AUSAs and FBI agents on August 29, 2019. The Lieutenant details his role, procedures at the Metropolitan Corrections Center (MCC) Special Housing Unit (SHU), and specific information regarding the housing and supervision of inmate Jeffrey Epstein prior to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate housed in the SHU at MCC. The interview details his housing assignments, interactions with staff, and the protocol surrounding his cellmate status.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's bunkie (cellmate) at the time the interviewed Lieutenant left work.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: A corrections officer mentioned in the context of suicide watch protocols. The Lieutenant notes that Thomas did not receive the relevant training.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A corrections officer mentioned alongside Thomas as someone who knows inmates on suicide watch are to be housed with a bunkie.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's bunkie (cellmate) in the SHU.
Corrections Officer Thomas was part of the staff responsible for supervising Epstein. The Lieutenant notes Thomas lacked specific training.

events.title: Incident between Epstein and cellmate
events.description: An incident occurred between Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate. The interviewed Lieutenant heard about it the next day and a Lieutenant completed an incident report (583 packet) with memos and photos.

events.title: Epstein housed with a bunkie
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had a bunkie (cellmate) on this date, which was standard practice for inmates coming off suicide watch.

events.title: FBI interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant was interviewed by SDNY Assistant U.S. Attorneys and FBI agents regarding procedures and events at MCC related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The interviewed BOP Lieutenant was the SHU Lieutenant when Jeffrey Epstein was assigned there. Epstein was initially in a high-profile area (10S lower) before being moved to SHU cell 201.
MCC executive management directed that Epstein be housed with a cellmate (bunkie). The Lieutenant was not asked for input and followed these orders.
There was an incident between Epstein and his cellmate on July 23, 2019, which resulted in an official incident report (583 packet).
Standard BOP protocol required inmates coming off suicide watch to be housed with a bunkie. Epstein had a bunkie on August 8, 2019, and Reyes was his bunkie later.

Communication regarding Epstein's need for a bunkie was spread by word of mouth, with no emails or other written communications noted. The Lieutenant also stated they were short-staffed and that CO Thomas had not received the relevant training.
